title: Using pochi with Seurat
text: Currently, pochi available Github can downloaded using devtools (remotes) package.
code: devtools::install_github("diegoalexespi/pochi")

title: Using pochi with Seurat
text: pochi package operates Seurat objects. load Seurat, SeuratData, pochi packages analyses, well magrittr package order improve legibility code using pipe %>% operator. load pbmc3k data SeuratData package.
code: require("Seurat") require("SeuratData") require("pochi") require("ggplot2") require("tidyr") pbmc3k_seurat <- pbmc3k.SeuratData::pbmc3k.final set.seed(789) pbmc3k_seurat$condition <- sample(c("WT", "KO"), size = ncol(pbmc3k_seurat), replace = TRUE) pbmc3k_seurat$replicate <- sample(1:3, size = ncol(pbmc3k_seurat), replace = TRUE) pbmc3k_seurat@meta.data %>% head() ##                orig.ident nCount_RNA nFeature_RNA seurat_annotations percent.mt ## AAACATACAACCAC     pbmc3k       2419          779       Memory CD4 T  3.0177759 ## AAACATTGAGCTAC     pbmc3k       4903         1352                  B  3.7935958 ## AAACATTGATCAGC     pbmc3k       3147         1129       Memory CD4 T  0.8897363 ## AAACCGTGCTTCCG     pbmc3k       2639          960         CD14+ Mono  1.7430845 ## AAACCGTGTATGCG     pbmc3k        980          521                 NK  1.2244898 ## AAACGCACTGGTAC     pbmc3k       2163          781       Memory CD4 T  1.6643551 ##                RNA_snn_res.0.5 seurat_clusters condition replicate ## AAACATACAACCAC               1               1        WT         1 ## AAACATTGAGCTAC               3               3        KO         1 ## AAACATTGATCAGC               1               1        KO         3 ## AAACCGTGCTTCCG               2               2        KO         1 ## AAACCGTGTATGCG               6               6        KO         1 ## AAACGCACTGGTAC               1               1        KO         1

title: Using pochi with Seurat
code: AbundancePlot(pbmc3k_seurat, group.by = "seurat_annotations", split.by = "condition", replicate.by = "replicate") AbundancePlot(pbmc3k_seurat, group.by = "seurat_annotations", split.by = "condition", replicate.by = "replicate", paired = TRUE, draw_paths = TRUE, sina_shift = FALSE)

title: Using pochi with Seurat
code: pbmc3k_seurat <- AssignQuantiles(pbmc3k_seurat, feature = "B2M", assay = "RNA", slot = "data", split.by = "condition", quantile.probs = c(0,0.4,0.8,1)) RidgePlot(pbmc3k_seurat, group.by = "B2M.quantile", features = "B2M") ## Picking joint bandwidth of 0.049

title: Using pochi with Seurat
code: BackgatePlot(pbmc3k_seurat, feature1 = "CD4", feature2 = "CD8A", metadata.col = "seurat_annotations", metadata.selection = "Memory CD4 T") BackgatePlot(pbmc3k_seurat, feature1 = "CD4", feature2 = "CD8A", metadata.col = "seurat_annotations", metadata.selection = "CD8 T")

title: Using pochi with Seurat
code: rna_markers <- presto::wilcoxauc(pbmc3k_seurat, group_by = "seurat_annotations") top_rna_markers <- rna_markers %>%      dplyr::filter(padj < 0.01, logFC > 0) %>%     dplyr::group_by(group) %>%      dplyr::slice_min(padj, with_ties = FALSE, n = 3) DoStarHeatmap(pbmc3k_seurat, diff_exp_results = rna_markers %>% dplyr::filter(group != "Platelet"), assay = "RNA", slot = "data", group.by = "seurat_annotations", p_val_choice = 0.01, logFC_choice = 2) ## diff_exp_results in Presto format ## ================================================== ## Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will ## replace the existing scale. ## Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which will ## replace the existing scale. ## Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will ## replace the existing scale. ## Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which will ## replace the existing scale. ## Warning: Removed 40 rows containing missing values (geom_text). DoClusteredHeatmap(pbmc3k_seurat, features = top_rna_markers$feature, assay = "RNA", group.by = "seurat_annotations") ## ================================================== ## Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will ## replace the existing scale. ## Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which will ## replace the existing scale. ## Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will ## replace the existing scale. ## Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which will ## replace the existing scale.

title: Using pochi with Seurat
code: MetaDataPlot(pbmc3k_seurat, group.by = "seurat_annotations", split.by = "replicate")

title: Using pochi with Seurat
code: pbmc3k_seurat <- CellCycleScoring(pbmc3k_seurat, s.features = cc.genes.updated.2019$s.genes, g2m.features = cc.genes.updated.2019$g2m.genes) ## Warning: The following features are not present in the object: DTL, UHRF1, EXO1, ## CASP8AP2, E2F8, not searching for symbol synonyms ## Warning: The following features are not present in the object: PIMREG, BUB1, ## HJURP, CDCA3, JPT1, TTK, CDC25C, DLGAP5, CDCA2, ANLN, GAS2L3, not searching for ## symbol synonyms ModulePlot(pbmc3k_seurat, features = "S.Score", assay = "RNA", split.by = "condition", replicate.by = "replicate") ## Error in (function (x, cutpoints = c(0.3, 0.6, 0.8, 0.9, 0.95), symbols = if (numeric.x) c(" ", : argument "x" is missing, with no default

title: NA
text: pochi: collection functions found online created supplement existing Seurat package. functions used : * https://github.com/immunogenomics/singlecellmethods

what: Plot cell abundances across groups in a Seurat object — AbundancePlot
title: Plot cell abundances across groups in a Seurat object — AbundancePlot
text: Plot cell abundances across groups Seurat object

title: Plot cell abundances across groups in a Seurat object — AbundancePlot
code: AbundancePlot(   object,   group.by,   split.by,   replicate.by,   draw_paths = FALSE,   perform.stat.test = TRUE,   test.choice = "t.test",   ncols = 3,   paired = FALSE,   set_minimum_to_zero = FALSE,   fill_colors = NULL,   point_colors = NULL,   p.adjust.method = "BH",   filter.p.above = 1,   step.increase = 0.15,   title_size = 10,   p_val_size = 2.5,   plot_type = "box",   sina_shift = TRUE,   x_lab = NULL,   y_lab = NULL,   point_size = 1,   same_y_limit = FALSE )

title: Plot cell abundances across groups in a Seurat object — AbundancePlot
text: object Seurat object group.meta.data slot use grouping cells split.meta.data slot use splitting groups replicate.meta.data slot use split.replicates draw_paths Whether draw paths abundance plots replicates exist perform.stat.test Whether perform statistical test splits test.choice choice test use (supports t.test wilcox) ncols Number columns plot groups paired Whether t.test paired using t.test set_minimum_to_zero Whether set minimum abundance plots 0 globally point_colors Vector colors color points p.adjust.method method use p-value adjustment mulitple testing filter.p.Plot p-values filter step.increase Tweaking space brackets p-values vertically title_size Text size group plot's title p_val_size Text size p-values plot_type Either box violin plot sina_shift Whether use ggforce::geom_sina pretty-shift points x_lab label x axis y_lab label y axis point_size Size points plotted same_y_limit Whether keep upper y limit constant across groups.

title: Plot cell abundances across groups in a Seurat object — AbundancePlot
text: Returns patchwork plot separate ggplots per group.variable

title: Plot cell abundances across groups in a Seurat object — AbundancePlot
text: Plots abundances specific groups Seurat object across split.variable, using replicate.replicates split.condition

title: Plot a metadata selection in a biaxial FeatureScatter plot — BackgatePlot
text: object Seurat object feature1 x-axis feature feature2 y-axis feature metadata.col column within object meta.data select metadata.selection entry within metadata.col highlight assay assay slot slot assay, typically data label.cols 2-d vector specifying colors labelling pt.size Size geom_point add.density Whether add geom_density_2d estimation figure density.col color density contour (added) high.p percentile set 1 new.assay Name new assay save values

title: Plot a metadata selection in a biaxial FeatureScatter plot — BackgatePlot
text: Returns Seurat object scaled values data slot specified assay

title: Plot a metadata selection in a biaxial FeatureScatter plot — BackgatePlot
text: Scales expression values feature specified assay 0 1, optional split.argument

what: Run UMAP on a Seurat object — BuildAnnoyUMAP
title: Run UMAP on a Seurat object — BuildAnnoyUMAP
text: Run UMAP Seurat object

title: Run UMAP on a Seurat object — BuildAnnoyUMAP
code: BuildAnnoyUMAP(   seurat_object,   dims,   reduction = "pca",   features = NULL,   graph_key = "annoy",   assay = DefaultAssay(seurat_object),   slot = "scale.data",   n.neighbors = 30L,   n.components = 2L,   metric = "cosine",   n.epochs = NULL,   prune.snn = 1/15,   learning.rate = 1,   min.dist = 0.3,   spread = 1,   set.op.mix.ratio = 1,   local.connectivity = 1L,   repulsion.strength = 1,   negative.sample.rate = 5,   a = NULL,   b = NULL,   uwot.sgd = FALSE,   seed.use = 42,   metric.kwds = NULL,   angular.rp.forest = FALSE,   reduction_key = "UMAP_",   verbose = TRUE,   reduction.name = "umap",   return.model = TRUE,   save.graphs = TRUE,   init.pos = "spectral",   scale = FALSE )

title: Run UMAP on a Seurat object — BuildAnnoyUMAP
text: dims dimensions reduction use input features reduction dimensional reduction use UMAP input. features NULL, run UMAP subset features (instead running set reduced dimensions). graph_key graph key, specifies string name returned graphs. annoy default assay Assay pull data using features, assay used construct Graph running UMAP Graph slot slot used pull data using features. data slot default. n.neighbors determines number neighboring points used local approximations manifold structure. Larger values result global structure preserved loss detailed local structure. general parameter often range 5 50. n.components dimension space embed . metric metric: determines choice metric used measure distance input space. wide variety metrics already coded, user defined function can passed long JITd numba. n.epochs number training epochs used optimizing low dimensional embedding. Larger values result accurate embeddings. NULL specified, value selected based size input dataset (200 large datasets, 500 small). prune.snn Sets cutoff acceptable Jaccard index computing neighborhood overlap SNN construction. edges values less equal set 0 removed SNN graph. Essentially sets stringency pruning (0 — pruning, 1 — prune everything). learning.rate initial learning rate embedding optimization. min.dist controls tightly embedding allowed compress points together. Larger values ensure embedded points moreevenly distributed, smaller values allow algorithm optimise accurately regard local structure. Sensible values range 0.001 0.5. spread effective scale embedded points. combination min.dist determines clustered/clumped embedded points . set.op.mix.ratio Interpolate (fuzzy) union intersection set operation used combine local fuzzy simplicial sets obtain global fuzzy simplicial sets. fuzzy set operations use product t-norm. value parameter 0.0 1.0; value 1.0 use pure fuzzy union, 0.0 use pure fuzzy intersection. local.connectivity local connectivity required - .e. number nearest neighbors assumed connected local level. higher value connected manifold becomes locally. practice local intrinsic dimension manifold. repulsion.strength Weighting applied negative samples low dimensional embedding optimization. Values higher one result greater weight given negative samples. negative.sample.rate number negative samples select per positive sample optimization process. Increasing value result greater repulsive force applied, greater optimization cost, slightly accuracy. specific parameters controlling embedding. NULL, values set automatically determined min. dist spread. Parameter differentiable approximation right adjoint functor. b specific parameters controlling embedding. NULL, values set automatically determined min. dist spread. Parameter differentiable approximation right adjoint functor. uwot.sgd Set uwot::umap(fast_sgd = TRUE); see umap details seed.use Set random seed. default, sets seed 42. Setting NULL set seed metric.kwds dictionary arguments pass metric, p value Minkowski distance. NULL arguments passed . angular.rp.forest Whether use angular random projection forest initialise approximate nearest neighbor search. can faster, mostly useful metric use angular style distance cosine, correlation etc. case metrics angular forests chosen automatically. verbose Controls verbosity reduction.name Name store dimensional reduction Seurat object return.model whether UMAP return uwot model save.graphs TRUE, addition embedding, also return nearest neighbor graphs (fuzzy, kNN, SNN, cosine) Graph objects Seurat object init.pos Type initialization coordinates. See uwot::umap details. scale Scaling apply embeddings. See uwot::umap object Seurat object densmap Whether use density-augmented objective densMAP. Turning option generates embedding local densities encouraged correlated original space. Parameters prefix ‘dens’ control behavior extension. Default FALSE. compatible 'umap-learn' method version umap-learn >= 0.5.0 densmap.kwds dictionary arguments pass densMAP optimization. dens.lambda Specific parameter controls regularization weight density correlation term densMAP. Higher values prioritize density preservation UMAP objective, vice versa values closer zero. Setting parameter zero equivalent running original UMAP algorithm. Default value 2. dens.frac Specific parameter controls fraction epochs (0 1) density-augmented objective used densMAP. first (1 - dens_frac) fraction epochs optimize original UMAP objective introducing density correlation term. Default 0.3. dens.var.shift Specific parameter specifies small constant added variance local radii embedding calculating density correlation objective prevent numerical instability dividing small number. Default 0.1. reduction.key dimensional reduction key, specifies string number dimension names. UMAP default

title: Seurat DimPlot enhancement III — DimPlotHighlight
text: Seurat DimPlot enhancement III

title: Seurat DimPlot enhancement III — DimPlotHighlight
code: DimPlotHighlight(   object,   dims = c(1, 2),   cells = NULL,   cols = NULL,   pt.size = NULL,   reduction = NULL,   group.by = NULL,   split.by = NULL,   shape.by = NULL,   order = NULL,   shuffle = FALSE,   seed = 1,   label = FALSE,   label.size = 4,   label.color = "black",   label.box = FALSE,   repel = FALSE,   cols.highlight = "#DE2D26",   sizes.highlight = 1,   na.value = "grey50",   ncol = NULL,   combine = TRUE,   raster = NULL,   metadata.col,   metadata.selection )

title: Seurat DimPlot enhancement III — DimPlotHighlight
text: object Seurat object dims Dimensions plot, must two-length numeric vector specifying x- y-dimensions cells Vector cells plot (default cells) cols Vector colors, color corresponds identity class. may also single character numeric value corresponding palette specified brewer.pal.info. default, ggplot2 assigns colors. also include number palettes pals package. See DiscretePalette details. pt.size Adjust point size plotting reduction dimensionality reduction use. specified, first searches umap, tsne, pca group.Name one metadata columns group (color) cells (example, orig.ident); pass 'ident' group identity class split.Name metadata column split plot ; see FetchData details shape.NULL, points circles (default). can specify cell attribute (can pulled FetchData) allowing different colors different shapes cells.  applicable raster = FALSE. order Specify order plotting idents. can useful crowded plots points interest buried. Provide either full list valid idents subset plotted last (top) shuffle Whether randomly shuffle order points. can useful crowded plots points interest buried. (default FALSE) seed Sets seed randomly shuffling order points. label Whether label clusters label.size Sets size labels label.color Sets color label text label.box Whether put box around label text (geom_text vs geom_label) repel Repel labels cols.highlight vector colors highlight cells ; repeat length groups cells.highlight sizes.highlight Size highlighted cells; repeat length groups cells.highlight na.value Color value NA points using custom scale ncol Number columns display combining plots combine Combine plots single patchworked ggplot object. FALSE, return list ggplot objects raster Convert points raster format, default NULL automatically rasterizes plotting 100,000 cells metadata.col column within object meta.data select metadata.selection entry within metadata.col highlight Seurat DimPlot

title: Seurat DimPlot enhancement III — DimPlotHighlight
text: Returns DimPlot

title: Seurat DimPlot enhancement III — DimPlotHighlight
text: Identical DimPlot additional step highlighting specific piece given metadata

code: DoClusteredDotPlot(   object,   features = NULL,   assay = "RNA",   slot = "data",   group.by = "seurat_clusters",   max_zed = 3,   y_text_size = 10,   scale_rows = TRUE,   plot_dendro = FALSE,   auc_choice = 0.6,   dot.scale = 5,   cluster_cols = TRUE )

title: Seurat DotPlot enhancement with hierarchical clustering — DoClusteredDotPlot
text: object Seurat object features features plot assay assay get expression values slot slot pull assay data group.metadata slot group cells max_zed Cutoff maximum z-scores (absolute value) y_text_size Size text y axis (features) scale_rows Whether scale expression per row plot_dendro Whether plot accompanying x-axis y-axis dendrograms dot.scale Value scale dots DotPlot cluster_cols Whether cluster columns well rows

title: Seurat DotPlot enhancement with hierarchical clustering — DoClusteredDotPlot

what: Heatmap of average expression values per group — DoClusteredHeatmap

title: Calculate Leiden clustering for a Graph object in Seurat — FindClustersLeiden
text: code adapted @immunogenomics/singlecellmethods tweaks flexibility added match arguments allowed leidenalg package. essence, using reticulate run leidenalg.find_partition(graph.name, partition_type) specified https://leidenalg.readthedocs.io/en/stable/intro.html. Arguments input find_partition function : https://leidenalg.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference.html#leidenalg.find_partition. Singletons excluded now, ideally can grouped step afterwards...

code: ModulePlot(   seurat_object,   assay = "AUC",   features = rownames(seurat_object[[assay]]),   split.by,   replicate.by,   draw_paths = FALSE,   perform.stat.test = TRUE,   test.choice = "t.test",   ncols = 3,   paired = FALSE,   set_minimum_to_zero = FALSE,   fill_colors = NULL,   point_colors = NULL,   p.adjust.method = "BH",   filter.p.above = 1,   step.increase = 0.15,   title_size = 10,   p_val_size = 2.5,   spacing_above = 1.3,   plot_type = "box",   sina_shift = TRUE,   x_lab = NULL,   y_lab = NULL,   same_y_limit = FALSE )

title: Plot avereage feature expression per sample across groups in a Seurat object — ModulePlot
text: assay Location features (typically gene module assay, RNA...) features features use grouping cells split.meta.data slot use splitting groups replicate.meta.data slot use split.replicates draw_paths Whether draw paths abundance plots replicates exist perform.stat.test Whether perform statistical test splits test.choice choice test use (supports t.test wilcox) ncols Number columns plot groups paired Whether t.test paired using t.test set_minimum_to_zero Whether set minimum abundance plots 0 globally point_colors Vector colors color points p.adjust.method method use p-value adjustment mulitple testing filter.p.Plot p-values filter step.increase Tweaking space brackets p-values vertically title_size Text size group plot's title p_val_size Text size p-values plot_type Either box violin plot sina_shift Whether use ggforce::geom_sina pretty-shift points x_lab label x axis y_lab label y axis same_y_limit Whether keep upper y limit constant across groups. object Seurat object point_size Size points plotted

title: Plot avereage feature expression per sample across groups in a Seurat object — ModulePlot
text: Returns patchwork plot separate ggplots per features specified

title: Plot avereage feature expression per sample across groups in a Seurat object — ModulePlot
text: Plots average expression specific features Seurat object across split.variable, using replicate.replicates split.condition. Typically used gene module testing. recommended RNA single-cell expression levels Gaussian.

text: Run AUCell Seurat object

title: Run AUCell on a Seurat object — RunAUCell
code: RunAUCell(   object,   assay = NULL,   slot = "counts",   genesets,   ranking.save = FALSE,   ranking.key = NULL,   normAUC = TRUE,   aucMaxRank = 0.05,   verbose = TRUE,   auc_assay_name = "AUC",   ... )

title: Run AUCell on a Seurat object — RunAUCell
text: object Seurat object assay Assay use building rankings. use default assay NULL. slot Slot use building rankings genesets list vectors features expression programs; entry vector feature names. list vectors named, resulting AUCell score expression program row AUCell assay returned. ranking.save TRUE, save new Assay `rankings` `object` rankings gene per cell. ranking.key NULL, pull Assay `rankings` `object` rather re-calculating rankings. normAUC Whether normalize maximum possible AUC per geneset 1 aucMaxRank Threshold calculate AUC (see details section details section AUCell_calcAUC) verbose Boolean. TRUE show progress messages, FALSE hide progress messages

title: Run AUCell on a Seurat object — RunAUCell
text: Returns Seurat object AUCell results stored Assay object within Seurat object

title: Run AUCell on a Seurat object — RunAUCell
text: (Copied verbatim AUCell::AUCell_calcAUC) _In simplified way, AUC value represents fraction genes, within top X genes ranking, included signature. parameter 'aucMaxRank' allows modify number genes (maximum ranking) used perform computation. default, set 5

title: Run AUCell on a Seurat object — RunAUCell
text: Aibar et al. (2017) SCENIC: single-cell regulatory network inference clustering. Nature Methods. doi: 10.1038/nmeth.4463
